case_vignette: A 60-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of a slowly enlarging painless ulcer on his lower lip. One year ago he had a painful rash near his upper lip that resolved completely with acyclovir therapy. He has a 10-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with metformin. He has worked in construction for the past 33 years. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years. Examination shows a 0.5 x 0.5 cm nontender ulcer with everted edges on the midline of his lower lip. The erythematous ulcer bleeds upon palpation. He has numerous moles of varying sizes all over his body. There are no palpable cervical lymph nodes.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Squamous cell carcinoma of the lip

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a slowly enlarging painless ulcer on my lower lip that has been there for about 3 months.
Have you had any significant weight loss, night sweats, or fever recently?
No, I have not experienced any significant weight loss, night sweats, or fever recently.
Do you use tobacco products or consume alcohol frequently?
Yes, I have been smoking a pack of cigarettes daily for 35 years.
Do you have any previous history of similar lesions or any other chronic diseases?
I had a painful rash near my upper lip a year ago, which cleared up with medication, and I have a 10-year history of type 2 diabetes.
Has there been any change in color or bleeding from the ulcer on your lip?
The ulcer on my lip bleeds when touched.
Final Diagnosis: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the lip.
